pros: It's a very great company!
cons: I don't believe it has any big cons.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Bellingham, WA
pros: Great benefits Set schedule of 12 hr shifts (4 days off) Most of the staff is amazing and are supportive colleagues
cons: Low pay for younger employees ($19.34 for someone with 7 years of caregiving experience and a Bachelor of Science degree in psychology) even though I often worked much harder than the people getting paid $10 more an hour under the same job title Education is not a factor in pay Management could be better

review_title: Low pay, high stress, not valued
pros: You can literally do anything and not be terminated because they are so short staffed.
cons: Super short staffed, over worked, under paid and the people running the show in the federal campus. Have no clue what it’s like to work the front lines. Takes forever to even be hired and they offer ridiculous wages for the risks associated with the job.

job_title: Care Coordinator in Friday Harbor, WA
pros: The community itself is extremely caring and your work is fulfilling.
cons: After only 4 months, I have found the toxic behavior of all employees at this location to be too difficult to cope with. The stress of their inappropriate criticism, their aggressive texts and emails, and their disrespect for my personal life has left me incredibly anxious and feeling physically sick when I entered the office. There is a culture of toxicity, mistrust, coworker-bashing, and micromanagement within this team, with no end in sight. It grows worse every passing day. It is unprofessional, and if my resignation is any proof, unsustainable. Attempts by the team to manage one another despite the impropriety of that relationship have led to an environment of suspicion, judgment, overreaching, and bullying. I cannot see how anyone can learn and be successful in this hostile work environment. Even though many of these things constitute a violation of company policy, HR worked very slowly to help me feel any relief.

pros: Not a bad place to work.
cons: Doesn’t pay great, RNs need higher wage

pros: Individual managers makes it possible to stay. Some room for advancement. Clientele is wonderful (although not easy). You learn so much working in community mental health.
cons: Low pay, higher turnover need better support from upper management, too focused on liability which interferes with client care at times.

job_title: Clinical Program Assistant in Mount Vernon, WA
pros: Great benefits due to being a Medicaid/State funded employer.
cons: There was no overtime hours allowed.

pros:
Flexible schedule
Chance for over time with crisis phone
Continued Learning trainings
cons:
No work life balance
Company cannot retain employees for more than two years tops. 
Underpaid by industry standards

review_title: Huge caseloads, massive paperwork, little quality time with clients
pros: I had a great supervisor - and post Master's it definitely provided tons of experience and ability to consult with other therapists as well as weekly with a psychologist and occasionally with the psychiatrists.
cons:
40 clients per week, unreasonable amounts of paperwork, I always felt like was drowning and that paperwork took priority over the clinical work with clients.
Very low pay, but a matching 401k and good insurance.

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Everett, WA
pros: Worked on good team, supervisors understood workload was heavy.
cons: Restructuring company reduced services for clients.

pros: Positive interactions with leadership, collaborative, great work/life balance, amazing benefits.
cons: Pay, lack of internal training opportunities, previous HR leadership was hard to work with.

pros: Great coworkers and rewarding work.
cons: Unsafe environment. Lack of response from management regarding safety issues. Terrible pay.

job_title: Social Worker/Case Manager in Everett, WA
pros: Supervision, nice people, work from home possible
cons: Poor pay, high caseload, lack of support

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Morro Bay, CA
pros: Good team members, good environment/management
cons: Understaffing can be stressful at times

job_title: Unit Leader in Saint Louis, MO
pros: supportive management and coworkers, trained on the job
cons: Little room to advance without an upper level degree

pros: Benefits: medical, vacation/sick, education hours/stipend...
cons: Employees are not treated with the same ethical standards they treat clients. Burnout is high as a result to being overworked and grossly underpaid.

review_title: If you are looking for advancement, don't bother
pros: Monday through Friday work schedule
cons: Poor pay , little to no advancement opportunities, Managers play favorites

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Everett, WA
pros: Good benefits and decent pay
cons: Minimal raise opportunities and long hours

job_title: Child and Family Therapist in Friday Harbor, WA
pros: The only reason to work here is to gain hours. However, you can get paid and earn hours in so many other ways. Before the pandemic, this was the only place to earn hours as an associate on the island. Now with telehealth, there are so many better ways to earn money and build up a solid practicee.
cons: Miserable wages. Toxic work environment. Psychologically abusive managers. Poor training. Cult-like atmosphere in the WISe program. Harassment by other colleagues. I experienced bullying on a regular basis by other coworkers and my supervisor blamed me and allowed it to continue. I became so physically sick from the bullying that I had to quit. Oh, and the unions did absolutely nothing, other than to take your hard-earned money. Culture of secrecy, where you are not supposed to tell families the truth. Care coordinators who pretend to be counselors and go on power trips, causing a great deal of damage to families. Getting in trouble for following code of ethics. There is no point working here, when you can make quadruple the amount of money as an associate and pay for your own insurance if you start your own business, pay for your own supervision, or contract with someone else or an umbrella agency. Also, as the only person of color in the group, I was treated as a pariah. They talk about diversity to make themselves feel good, but no one knows how to treat people of color well at Compass Health. Being a person of color makes you a target, and your supervisors will not stand up for you, but will make your life miserable if you make any complaints. Good luck trying to take a vacation, even if you scheduled it in advance. You will be so overworked and every minute of your day, you are on call and can't just walk away from the job. Excessive amounts of needless paperwork and drama.

job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Everett, WA
pros:
*lot's of autonomy
*great co-workers
*good salary and benefits
cons:
*frequent staff turnover
*company policies always changing
*limited support

job_title: Office Manager in Friday Harbor, WA
pros: Great team to work with
cons: Not a lot of cons

job_title: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist in Lynnwood, WA
pros: flexible and proactive, excellent client care
cons: clinician compensation could be better

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Arroyo Grande, CA
pros: hours, hard working coworkers, nice location
cons: over worked employees that should be paid a little more

job_title: Marketing Communications Manager in Everett, WA
pros: Your coworkers really care about the community they are serving. Compensation wise, you don't have to pay for any of your benefits.
cons: The pay is not comparable.

pros: Great way to get hours for your license.
cons: High caseload, turn over and sporadic support for staff.

pros: Loved the patients and the job up until my last month there. It was great!
cons: Nurses can do whatever they want and treat MHTs like crap. Everyone is so clickey. Always drama. If asked to pick up a shift, God forbid you say no.

pros:
Coworkers are great
Working hours are standard
cons:
Supervisors often clueless
Useless union reps

review_title: Truly get to make a difference
pros: Patients are amazing and benefits are good
cons: Many in management have no business being managers.

job_title: Youth Peer Support Specialist in Marysville, WA
pros: Community and room for growth.
cons: Can’t think of any yet.

pros: Great colleagues and culture of collaboration
cons: Poor pay, which is expected in community mental health

pros: Compass Health offers a good starting point for young therapists right out of graduate school. Opportunity to gain lots of experience working with a diverse population of primarily medicaid clientele.
cons: Compass Health offers very low wages for Master's level employees ($16 hour). Productivity expectations are high, and the clientele is very challenging. Benefits are poor, and the cost of adding dependents or a spouse to insurance plan is outrageous. Many employees that I work with cannot afford to add their family to the insurance plan, so their children are also on medicaid, just like the clients we serve. I just received my annual pay raise of 37 cents, and I'm not joking.

review_title: Worked here for about a year
pros: Flexible schedule, benefits, options to work some overtime. Non profit can help with student loans after 10 years. I have been able to change schedules several times to suit my needs with my kids and I have had flexibility to come in late on certain days to get my son on the bus. This is a huge plus for a single parent. Decent vacation time throughout year and Education hours yearly to use to get more training. Company focused on helping clients to improve recovery. Union does a good job of making sure we have a good health plan unless you are management.
cons: Lack of organization, high management turn over. Lower pay compared to some peer jobs in say Seattle.

job_title: Clinician II (Mental Health Counselor) in Boston, MA
pros: Excellent chance to get a broad range of experience for a new comer. The experiences and different populations of clients I was exposed to and had the chance to work with was invaluable!
cons:
High staff and patient turnover. Work demands and requirements are intense. It is manageable, but you need to have strong self-care and support in order to maintain a good work-life balance. 
Patient care suffers due to the requirements to fit x-amount of patients in a day, complete assessments and take care of case management and case notes in a 40 hours work week.

review_title: Great place to start, Unfair pay
job_title: Mental Health Tech III/Community Support Partner in Everett, WA
pros: Friendly helpful coworkers, great place to get your foot in the door, Flexible(ish) hours
cons: The worst paying company I have ever worked for. There is an employee that works in the same position as me, who has been here for 3 months, only has a HS Diploma, and makes over $2/hour more than me because of "experience". This person is younger than me, I actually have 3 children (which they wanted us to have experience with), and though I only have an AS degree, I am still way more qualified than this other person. It was insulting to offer such little pay to a person that actually has a family to support.

pros: A great chance to start your career in this field and get trainings and skills that would be harder to get with only a B.A. or lesser degree. Also, friendly coworkers and paid trainings.
cons: Really bad coffee. No joke. Also, management is really young and although they mean well, do not have nearly as much experience as you would expect. That being said, no complaints yet and they work hard. Demands are also intense. Pay should be higher.

review_title: Compass Health Cares for its Community
pros: They offer great benefits, pleasant work culture, very positive most of the time.  I haven't been there really long, but I like how everyone's work is so worthwhile.  The people that stay there aren't there for the money and really want to help people.  Communication is very open between upper management and staff.
cons: As a non-profit company wages are lower, staff can get overworked and stressed.

pros: Compass Health/Pathways provides an overall good work environment, with support to grow professionally and family-friendly corporate policies.
cons: The pay is lousy, even for a non-profit. They under-pay for the work they hire you for, not the work you actually perform.

review_title: Not a good place to work
pros: Several locations and positions available
cons: Less-trained, "warm bodies hired off the street", hostile work environment, jealousy, personal problems brought to work inflicted on professional employees, feel ganged up on

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Everett, WA
pros: Variety of training, with an educational fund for external trainings or relevant educational materials. Good benefits. Good holiday pay.
cons: Management is unreliable and flippant. Forced some clients to transition to community ready, minimizing available services. Keeping clients longer than necessary in locked facilities to maximize profit. For the profit and not for the client.

job_title: RN Manager in San Luis Obispo, CA
pros: Most of the coworkers are nice and so are the residents
cons: The upper management in the corporate office are sleeping with the employees. Someone else was right about the anonymous line not being anonymous, what a joke! They deserved to get sued. They promote people with poor work ethic, bad attitudes and no real experience, pay raises are few and far between. They turn a blind eye to illegal activity and harassment from administration

job_title: Integrated Health Specialist in Wentzville, MO
pros: Flexible schedule, working with community
cons: Lack of communication, poor training.

review_title: Rewarding work, great work environment, some good leadership
pros: Good work environment - relaxed; great teams and work colleagues; great benefits - time off, retirement benefits;
cons: Low on compensation compared to similar companies;

pros: flexibility in the time you come in, friendly co-workers, chance to branch out and try new things, wooded location.
cons: lots of red tape around tracking your productivity, union had to fight off company from screwing employees out of benefits, low pay.

pros: Great time off accrual.  Clients truly appreciate employees who help them, but also know who the slackers are.  HR seems to want to help employees but are disconnected from field work.
cons: Good employees with strong work ethic not appreciated.  Too many coworkers are lazy and don't follow basic protocols.  Management absent.

job_title: Certified Peer Counselor in Oak Harbor, WA
pros: Compass has a great team of people working in the WISe program
cons: Productivity is sometimes difficult to achieve, month after month

pros: Time off, education expense, close to home
cons: The pay was too low

pros: Have 15+ years of Customer Service, Behavioral Health, Medical Insurance. Fast learner willing to learn in a new company.
cons: Always willing to learn at new projects.

pros: Supportive environment generally speaking. Coworkers are fun people.
cons: Not unique to this employer, but staff are not valued unless somehow perceived as a rising star.
